critique: This document establishes a board to investigate a dispute between railroad companies and their employees, invoking the Railway Labor Act. It aims to prevent interruption of interstate commerce. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It seems to be a fairly neutral intervention to resolve a labor dispute. However, by intervening in a labor dispute, it could be seen as a form of economic regulation, albeit a moderate one. It also centralizes authority in the federal government to resolve the dispute.
